sections.content: Music enhances videos but copyright issues can demonetize, mute, or remove your content. Understanding licensing options keeps your channel safe while still using great music. Here's how to navigate YouTube music rights.

faq.question: Can I use popular songs?
faq.answer: Almost never without issues. Even short clips get detected. Content ID finds most copyrighted music. Result is usually monetization by rights holder. Best to use licensed music.

faq.question: Is YouTube Audio Library good?
faq.answer: Yes—completely free and safe. Limited selection compared to paid services. Quality varies. Good for starting out. Many creators upgrade to paid libraries eventually.

faq.question: What about copyright-free claims?
faq.answer: Creators sometimes claim 'copyright-free' incorrectly. Always verify actual license. Free doesn't always mean unrestricted. Read terms. Keep documentation. Trust established sources.

faq.question: Do I need music in videos?
faq.answer: Not always—some content works better without. Silence or minimal music is valid choice. Don't add music just because. Consider if music adds or distracts. Test with audience.
